ai.summary: Mulbarton’s Old Witch Trail is a 14.3 km moderate loop through mixed UK countryside, offering woodland paths, open fields, and quiet rural lanes.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines wooded trails, grassy fields, and farm tracks with uneven ground, occasional mud, stiles and gates, and short stretches on quiet roads. Expect a mix of shaded and exposed sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and layered clothing. Carry a map and compass (or GPS) and know how to use them. Stay on marked paths, close gates behind you, and watch for livestock. Bring enough water and snacks, a basic first aid kit, a charged phone, and a whistle. Let someone know your planned route and estimated return time.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Charged mobile phone and power bank
Headlamp or flashlight (if finishing after dusk)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) usually offers milder weather and better visibility; winter hikes are possible but can be boggy, muddy, and have shorter daylight.

seo.title: Mulbarton’s Old Witch Trail – 14.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Mulbarton’s Old Witch Trail, a 14.3 km moderate hike in the UK. Enjoy woodland and rural lanes along a varied 14.3 km route with practical tips, gear lists, and safety notes.
